Hi, I'm integrating HubSpot with my Laravel Apps. When trying to create an Order Object it throws this error message "_Currency Code must be predefined_". I searched on internet, but no solution over there. Will you guys help me to solve this issue? #help <#C04A3FUK8HK|crm-development-beta>
Hello <@U06UPMG0KEV> <@U01QVR44MEY> Did you find a solution to update a conditional-properties via API?

Friends, could you help please!
When retrieving metadata about properties, _how can I identify that it is a number with a *percentage type*_? In the metadata, this property `type` and `fieldType` have the value `number`.
They haven’t exposed any of the conditionals or property rules through the API yet

Hello everyone,

But if we are creating a custom html form, then we can use HubSpot API's to update the values in the second dropdown.
<@U078ZGBTMND> <@U01QVR44MEY>

Hi team 

I ran a few API requests using /crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/upset and received an error: “internal error” with no further explanation except for the correlationid. Have anyone encountered some similar and know what could be the error?

Does anyone know if it’s possible to get a list of import names (text value) based on the ID’s? HubSpot provides the text value visually in the UI but upon export only provides the ID string.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/imports#get-previous-imports|I found this api> (`/crm/v3/imports/{importId}`) but private app access tokens don’t work since they can only see what that specific app has imported and I’m trying to lookup the standard imports done natively thru HubSpot.
Of course! I would love to know how we can make this process easier. If you’re open to it, I would love to set up some time to hear your feedback! <@U07NH4G6X8U> I’ll send you a message
